in some environments php's error reporting is set to this setting cause warning messages about code parts that do use a function call as a reference instead of an explicit variable
this is not an error per se the code still works but it is not compliant to strict coding conventions
one solution would be to switch off strict error reporting in php
however some users do not have access to their provider's php settings
please change tcn code to strict coding conventions

it is not possible to create users with a hyphen in their user name however if i directly edit the database it works
please use a more sensible rule for user names which is compatible with basic os rules

taken from a websphere document as a rough guideline under normal circumstances a valid user id and password can contain the following characters lowercase characters uppercase characters numbers exclamation point open parenthesis close parenthesis dash this character is not supported as the first character in the user id or password period this character is not supported as the first character in the user id or password underscore this is the only supported special character in ibm i grave accent tilde commercial at hash mark or pound sign single and double quotation marks although these two characters are supported using both in a single user id is not supported
ensure that you are not using both the characters in a single user id

and here is google take on the topic when choosing usernames and passwords for users and groups you add to your google cloud account consider the following usernames can contain letters numbers dashes underscores apostrophes and periods usernames contain an ampersand equal sign brackets plus sign comma or more than one period in a row
usernames can begin or end with non-alphanumeric characters except periods with a maximum of characters
passwords can contain any combination of printable ascii characters and must contain a minimum of characters
passwords begin or end with a whitespace character
first and last names support characters with a maximum of characters
periods are not ignored as they are in a gmail.com account
if you create a user account called username this user will not be able to receive messages addressed to user.name or any other combination of periods
to let a user receive mail with these variations create an email alias for them
if you set a region other than default in month view when viewing a calendar and then delete the calendar belonging to that region and go to view calendar month an error is displayed
only way i found so far is to add to the url which then switches the region previously selected in the view back to default

problem when mobile display support is on the calendar view times out with larger amounts of users
reason currently tcn prepares every possible table layout needed for all the common device screen widths and then sends all of them to the clients browser
when the screen size changes the user turns the device the correct layout is already there and will adjust automatically
so several table layouts are prepared even though one is needed at a time
with a large amount of users that might quickly end up into long processing time thus it may time out
another downside is the large amount of data that has to be sent to the client
challenge tcn is a script running on the web server
it does not know what screen width the client is using
when the screen changes on client side there are two ways to serve that event all necessary html data was already prepared and sent to the client and the display adjusts right away
tcn needs to be told that the screen size has changed so it can prepare the apppropriate table layout for it and send it back to the client
assumption preparing all possible table layouts at once is convenient on client's side but also assumes that a lot of screen width changes occur there
i believe that is not the case
usually the client works with one layout only
it can be considered fairly rare that a screen width change happens
approach let the user decide what screen width he needs
offer a selection dialog for the user
that information is sent back to tcn so it can return the appropriate table layout
this is less convenient on client's side but surely quicker and more appropriate to the common use case that the screen width rarely changes during a session
save the last screen width selection in the user profile

we run our calendar specifically for a single year in our case jan dec
it would be a really nice feature if you could set a custom view for users so that they can only see the specified
for example we don't want them to be able to look back to the previous year or look forward into the next year until we allow them
in tc pro they can pick dec and choose months
that will then show them december of the current year and then months into next year which we don't want them to be able to do
what we'd like to achieve is them logging in and seeing months for their group from january through to december or whatever custom period is
the ability to change error messages for declinations would be nice which is stored in the database instead of being as every time we upgrade the software those changes are overwritten
as an organisation we open our calendar for staff to start requesting absences for the new year in november
we set a date eg monday nov and the absences can be requested from this period if a conflict ie people request the same then we authorise it on a first come first serve basis
the downside is we have to manually open the calendar at on sunday evening

which means waiting up until then remembering to do it and also relying on doing it properly to open it we simply remove the declination period this would be set to decline all requests from by removing this declination period they can then start to request absences
what would be great is a feature in the declination management that says something like remove this declination automatically or something similar

that way we could set up all absence requests to be declined from january but this declination would automatically be removed on sunday november at or whatever at which point it would no longer decline their request

jam like jira maintains different tables for projects actors components issuetypes and versions
currently when the project list is reloaded the actors components issue types and versions tables are not cleared
so if they had been read before the data is outdated then
it might be still correct or not

that leads to the situation that the project lead column is empty while the actors button is still green from the last actor reload
a new actor reload is necessary to get the project lead
the project lead is specific information and requires a separate rest request

putting that into the loop of the project reload will time out double as much rest question should the actors components issue types and versions also be cleared when the project list is reloaded in my opinon this makes sense because all that information is definitely outdated and might not be correct anymore
